definition: Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station

sentences.english: Yi Zhuan put the philosophy of appropriateness and harmoniousness of Confucianism to a new peak.
sentences.chinese: 《易传》把儒家的中和哲学推到了一个新高峰。

sentences.english: Yi Zhuan was one of the most important works exhibiting this tendency.
sentences.chinese: 《易传》就是最能彰显这一时代特征的重要著作之一。

sentences.english: This view has its positive significance.
sentences.chinese: 《易传》的性别形而上学有其积极意义。

definition: to interpret the divinatory trigrams
The Book of Changes ("I Ching")

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
philosophical book by Song dynasty scholar Zhou Dunyi 周敦頤|周敦颐[Zhou1 Dun1 yi2], starting from an interpretation of the Book of Changes
the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (I Ching or Yi Jing) 易經|易经
cosmology
Luxuriant Dew of the Spring and Autumn Annals, ideological tract by Han dynasty political philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒[Dong3 Zhong4 shu1]
to interpret the divinatory trigrams
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
interpretation of the divinatory trigrams
the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
to foretell the future using the trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经
to explain/to interpret/interpretation
